results.title: Emma Thompson and the Challenge of Baring All Onscreen at 63
results.abstract: The actress made the choice to disrobe. Still, she says, it was the most difficult thing she’s ever done in her four-decade career.
des_facet: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande (Movie)

multimedia.caption: If “you want the iconography of the female body to change,” Emma Thompson said, “then you better be part of the change.”
multimedia.copyright: Charlotte Hadden for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Cha Cha Real Smooth’ Review: The Boy in the Bubble
results.abstract: A recent college graduate moves back home, drifts along and strikes up an unlikely friendship with a single mother in this Sundance indie.

multimedia.caption: Cooper Raiff, left, with Evan Assante in “Cha Cha Real Smooth.” In the film, which he also directed and wrote, he plays a recent college grad who works at a fast-food joint.
Cooper Raiff, left, with Evan Assante in “Cha Cha Real Smooth.” In the film, which he also directed and wrote, he plays a recent college grad who works at a fast-food joint.
Cooper Raiff, left, with Evan Assante in “Cha Cha Real Smooth.” In the film, which he also directed and wrote, he plays a recent college grad who works at a fast-food joint.

results.title: ‘Lightyear’ Review: Infinite Buzz
results.abstract: The new Pixar movie recounts the adventures of Star Command’s most famous Space Ranger before he was a toy.

multimedia.caption: Buzz Lightyear, voiced by Chris Evans, in “Lightyear,” an offshoot of the “Toy Story” franchise directed by Angus MacLane.
Buzz Lightyear, voiced by Chris Evans, in “Lightyear,” an offshoot of the “Toy Story” franchise directed by Angus MacLane.
Buzz Lightyear, voiced by Chris Evans, in “Lightyear,” an offshoot of the “Toy Story” franchise directed by Angus MacLane.

results.title: ‘Spiderhead’ Review: Prisoners of the Mind
results.abstract: This latest Joseph Kosinski film — set in a penitentiary that dispenses aphrodisiacs and fear-inducers — couldn’t be more unlike his “Top Gun: Maverick.”

multimedia.caption: Chris Hemsworth, the mastermind in ”Spiderhead.”
Chris Hemsworth, the mastermind in ”Spiderhead.”
Chris Hemsworth, the mastermind in ”Spiderhead.”

results.title: In the Documentaries of the Blackwood Brothers, Great Artists Are Explored
results.abstract: Several films from Michael and Christian Blackwood, grounded in the nitty-gritty of art-making, are available to watch through June 28.
org_facet: Pioneer Works Center for Art and Innovation (Brooklyn, NY)

multimedia.caption: Thelonious Monk in the documentary “Monk in Europe,” directed by Michael and Christian Blackwood.
Thelonious Monk in the documentary “Monk in Europe,” directed by Michael and Christian Blackwood.

results.title: ‘Good Luck to You, Leo Grande’ Review: Pleasure Principles
results.abstract: Emma Thompson and Daryl McCormack bring knowing vulnerability to this amusing story of a foxy prostitute and the woman who hires him.
des_facet: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Daryl McCormack and Emma Thompson in “Good Luck to You, Leo Grande.”
Daryl McCormack and Emma Thompson in “Good Luck to You, Leo Grande.”
Daryl McCormack and Emma Thompson in “Good Luck to You, Leo Grande.”

results.title: ‘Halftime’ Review: Let’s Get Loud
results.abstract: In the Netflix documentary about Jennifer Lopez’s life and career by the director Amanda Micheli, the political moments are brief, and then it’s back to rehearsal.

multimedia.caption: In “Halftime,” the director Amanda Micheli does her best to effectively tell a story that reaches beyond what it seems Jennifer Lopez wants you to know.
In “Halftime,” the director Amanda Micheli does her best to effectively tell a story that reaches beyond what it seems Jennifer Lopez wants you to know.
In “Halftime,” the director Amanda Micheli does her best to effectively tell a story that reaches beyond what it seems Jennifer Lopez wants you to know.

results.title: ‘Official Competition’ Review: Madness in Their Methods
results.abstract: In this very meta comedy, Antonio Banderas, Penélope Cruz and Oscar Martínez deliver a master class on actors and their egos.

multimedia.caption: Antonio Banderas as a preening actor and Penélope Cruz as a mad-genius (or just mad?) director in “Official Competition.”
Antonio Banderas as a preening actor and Penélope Cruz as a mad-genius (or just mad?) director in “Official Competition.”
Antonio Banderas as a preening actor and Penélope Cruz as a mad-genius (or just mad?) director in “Official Competition.”

results.title: ‘Jerry & Marge Go Large’ Review: You Don’t Know Jackpot
results.abstract: Bryan Cranston and Annette Bening play an aging couple who cash in on a lottery loophole in this flavorless comedy.

multimedia.caption: Bryan Cranston and Annette Bening in “Jerry & Marge Go Large.”
Bryan Cranston and Annette Bening in “Jerry & Marge Go Large.”
Bryan Cranston and Annette Bening in “Jerry & Marge Go Large.”

results.title: Watch Bryce Dallas Howard’s Slow Escape in ‘Jurassic World Dominion’
results.abstract: The director Colin Trevorrow narrates a sequence featuring the actor, a testy Therizinosaurus and a murky pond.

results.title: Andy Garcia Is the Father of the Bride in More Ways Than One
results.abstract: The actor, who’s playing the role onscreen and in reality, understands his rigid character: “He’s an amalgamation of everybody I’ve ever known, including myself.”

multimedia.caption: Garcia said his decision to act was concerning to his father, whose conception of actors ran to stars like Humphrey Bogart: “I’m sure in the back of his mind he said, ‘I love my son, but he’s no Humphrey Bogart.’”
multimedia.copyright: Daniel Dorsa for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Garcia said his decision to act was concerning to his father, whose conception of actors ran to stars like Humphrey Bogart: “I’m sure in the back of his mind he said, ‘I love my son, but he’s no Humphrey Bogart.’”

results.title: Cooper Raiff, Arriving Early to the Party
results.abstract: At 25, the indie writer, director and actor is making waves in Hollywood. His second feature, “Cha Cha Real Smooth,” could start a new career chapter.

results.title: A Filmmaker Imagines a Japan Where the Elderly Volunteer to Die
results.abstract: The premise for Chie Hayakawa’s film, “Plan 75,” is shocking: a government push to euthanize the elderly. In a rapidly aging society, some also wonder: Is the movie prescient?

multimedia.caption: Chie Hayakawa in Tokyo. Her new film “Plan 75” takes on one of the biggest elephants in the room in Japan: the challenges of dealing with the world’s oldest society.
multimedia.copyright: Noriko Hayashi for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Chie Hayakawa in Tokyo. Her new film “Plan 75” takes on one of the biggest elephants in the room in Japan: the challenges of dealing with the world’s oldest society.
multimedia.copyright: Noriko Hayashi for The New York Times

results.title: Phil Tippett’s World in (Stop) Motion
results.abstract: The animator and visual effects artist, whose credits include “Jurassic Park” and “The Empire Strikes Back,” has directed his passion project, “Mad God.”

results.title: ‘My Fake Boyfriend’ Review: Deepfake Dating
results.abstract: A gay man gets trapped in a web of lies after his overeager best friend concocts an artificial relationship for him on social media.

results.title: ‘Stay Prayed Up’ Review: Spreading the Gospel of Love
results.abstract: A new documentary about the gospel ensemble the Branchettes and its guiding light, Lena Mae Perry, is a plain-spoken tribute.

multimedia.caption: Lena Mae Perry, a powerful alto in her 80s, in “Stay Prayed Up.”
Lena Mae Perry, a powerful alto in her 80s, in “Stay Prayed Up.”

results.title: ‘Sing, Dance, Act: Kabuki Featuring Toma Ikuta’ Review: A New Path
results.abstract: Cameras follow Ikuta, an actor on popular Japanese teen dramas in the 2000s, as he learns Kabuki’s expressions and movements from a friend.

results.title: ‘Bitterbrush’ Review: Alone on the Range
results.abstract: Though this quiet documentary about two young range riders recalls a western or two, it presents a modern-day portrait of hard work and friendship.

multimedia.caption: Colie Moline, left, and Hollyn Patterson in the documentary “Bitterbrush.”
Colie Moline, left, and Hollyn Patterson in the documentary “Bitterbrush.”

results.abstract: The comic performer David Earl plays a lonely inventor who builds a robot friend in this bionic buddy comedy.

results.title: ‘Father of the Bride’ Review: A Remake With a Cuban Twist
results.abstract: A Cuban American family walks down the aisle, treading carefully along the line separating tradition and tomorrow.

results.title: ‘Cocoon’ Review: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
results.abstract: Sunshine, ice pops and rainbow flags mark a summer of transformation for a teenager in Berlin in the coming-of-age drama, “Cocoon.”

results.abstract: Strong acting and a cool setting elevate this surreal tale of artistic compulsion.

results.title: ‘Mad God’ Review: Highway to Hell
results.abstract: In this mostly animated experiment, the filmmaker Phil Tippett leads us through a stop-motion inferno of despair and devastation.

results.title: ‘A Man of Integrity’ Review: Fighting Dirty
results.abstract: Mohammad Rasoulof’s scathing drama about corruption in Iran is striking in its blunt rage, if somewhat exasperating in its monotony.

results.title: Kevin Spacey, Accused of Sexual Assault, Appears in British Court
results.abstract: The proceedings are a rare example of a celebrity #MeToo case leading to criminal charges.

multimedia.caption: Kevin Spacey arriving on Thursday at Westminster Magistrates’ Court in London.
Kevin Spacey arriving on Thursday at Westminster Magistrates’ Court in London.
Kevin Spacey arriving on Thursday at Westminster Magistrates’ Court in London.

results.title: Disney’s ‘Lightyear,’ With a Same-Sex Kiss, Faces a Backlash in Some Muslim Countries
results.abstract: The United Arab Emirates banned the animated film, an offshoot of the “Toy Story” movies, from its cinemas. Censors in Indonesia and Malaysia are also considering restrictions.

multimedia.caption: Alisha Hawthorne, voiced by Uzo Aduba, in a scene from “Lightyear.” The character kisses her wife in one scene, which has prompted restrictions on the film in some countries.
Alisha Hawthorne, voiced by Uzo Aduba, in a scene from “Lightyear.” The character kisses her wife in one scene, which has prompted restrictions on the film in some countries.
Alisha Hawthorne, voiced by Uzo Aduba, in a scene from “Lightyear.” The character kisses her wife in one scene, which has prompted restrictions on the film in some countries.

results.title: ‘Raisin in the Sun’ and ‘The Harder They Come’ Part of Public Theater Season
results.abstract: Two new works by Suzan-Lori Parks will be included in a season that delves into “relationships between Black and white America.”

results.title: David Morse Steadies Himself With Daily Devotions and His Own Cooking
results.abstract: The actor, who was just in “How I Learned to Drive” on Broadway, also has an affection for bluegrass, reading out loud and his Mercedes Sprinter van.

results.title: Amber Heard: I ‘Stand by Every Word’ of Testimony in Defamation Trial
results.abstract: In her first public interview since losing a defamation case brought against her by Johnny Depp, her ex-husband, Ms. Heard said she had told the truth when she accused him of abuse.

multimedia.caption: Amber Heard, leaving court in Virginia during the trial. She gave her first public interview since the verdict, the first part of which was aired on Tuesday.
Amber Heard, leaving court in Virginia during the trial. She gave her first public interview since the verdict, the first part of which was aired on Tuesday.

results.title: How Elvis Measured His Success: With Watches
results.abstract: The legend’s hips weren’t the only things keeping time, says Catherine Martin, the production designer for Baz Luhrmann’s new biopic.

multimedia.caption: Austin Butler, who stars in Baz Luhrmann’s new “Elvis” biopic. The production team viewed the way Elvis wore, collected and traded watches as essential to telling the story of how he became “the King.”

Austin Butler, who stars in Baz Luhrmann’s new “Elvis” biopic. The production team viewed the way Elvis wore, collected and traded watches as essential to telling the story of how he became “the King.”

results.title: You Need a Horror Movie Friend for a More Frightening, Less Lonely Life
results.abstract: You can’t undo what is terrible about the universe, but you can stand against it together.

results.title: Philip Baker Hall, Actor Familiar as Authority Figures, Dies at 90
results.abstract: He appeared in “Secret Honor,” “Boogie Nights,” “Seinfeld” and dozens of other movies and television shows.

multimedia.caption: Philip Baker Hall in 1996. Over five decades he acted in more than 80 films and 200 television appearances, as well as in theater.
Philip Baker Hall in 1996. Over five decades he acted in more than 80 films and 200 television appearances, as well as in theater.

results.title: London Police Charge Kevin Spacey With Sexual Assault
results.abstract: The actor will appear in a London court on Thursday to start what could be a lengthy trial process over multiple allegations of sexual assault.

multimedia.caption: Kevin Spacey arriving to face a sexual assault charge at Nantucket District Court in Nantucket, Mass., in 2019. Prosecutors later dropped the case.
Kevin Spacey arriving to face a sexual assault charge at Nantucket District Court in Nantucket, Mass., in 2019. Prosecutors later dropped the case.
